meanings.definition: A set of DNA variations or polymorphisms that are inherited together
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the haplotype of the family to understand their genetic similarities.
meanings.sent2: The haplotype of the siblings showed common genetic markers passed down from their parents.
meanings.sent3: The haplotype of the twins was so similar that they joked about being genetic clones.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic puzzle, the haplotype was the key piece that revealed their shared ancestry.
meanings.sent5: The haplotype, like a genetic fingerprint, identified their familial connection.

meanings.definition: A group of alleles on a single chromosome that are inherited together
meanings.sent1: The haplotype on the chromosome determined the individual's genetic traits.
meanings.sent2: Each haplotype on the chromosome carried specific genetic information.
meanings.sent3: The haplotype on the chromosome seemed to have a mind of its own, passing traits in unison.
meanings.sent4: The haplotype on the chromosome acted like a genetic package deal, bundling traits together.
meanings.sent5: The haplotype on the chromosome was like a genetic tag team, working together to determine characteristics.
